newsitem.title: UK: Clarke says pound will do huge harm to UK industry.
newsitem.headline: Clarke says pound will do huge harm to UK industry.

text.p: The present strength of the pound will do "huge damage" to British manufacturing, Kenneth Clarke, until May 1 Chancellor of the Exchequer, said on Wednesday.
"The pound is being driven up to great new heights which will do huge damage to the manufacturing base of this country," Clarke said in an interview with BBC radio.
Clarke blamed the new Chancellor Gordon Brown for pushing up the pound's value by changing Britain's economic policy.

"The reason the pound is climbing is he instantly raised interest rates when he came in, he gave the Bank of England independence in circumstances where it was obvious they were going to raise interest rates steadily," Clarke said.

"Instead of making their mind up how far they are going to go they keep raising them by little bits every month, and as sure as God made little apples, people think they are going to put them up again." -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 77567
